report_title: Industry Research: Aerial Work Platform Manufacturing
executive_summary: The Aerial Work Platform Manufacturing industry has declined over the five years to 2022, albeit with significant volatility from year to year. Industry demand is primarily driven by construction activity because aerial work platforms are used by nearly all construction industries. Additionally, the largest buyer of industry goods is construction equipment rental companies. As downstream demand from most construction markets increased as the five-year period began, rental companies sought to increase their stock, boosting revenue. However, the onset of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and subsequent decline in construction activity severely hampered industry revenue in 2020, with revenue falling 39.4% in 2020 alone. Over the five years to 2022, industry revenue is expected to decrease at an annualized rate of 4.1% to $4.9 billion, despite an expected 8.5% rise in 2022 due to an uptick in construction activity.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The industry is a critical supplier to the construction sector
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Aerial Work Platform Manufacturing industry is a critical supplier to the construction sector because it manufactures boom lifts, scissor lifts and other aerial work platforms, which are used throughout the construction process to elevate workers and equipment. As a result, demand for industry services is heavily influenced by the performance of the construction sector in the United States.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue declined over the past five years
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over past five years, industry revenue is estimated to decrease at an annualized rate of 4.1% to $4.9 billion. In 2022 industry revenue is anticipated to rise 8.5%, amid an anticipated increase in construction activity as the economy continues to recover from lows endured during the pandemic.

Over the past five years, growth in housing starts and residential construction for the majority of the period bolstered demand from the construction sector, this industry's key downstream market. As the construction sector experienced increased activity, the improving economic outlook helped to stimulate a wave of new spending on aerial work platforms and construction machinery, bolstering industry revenue early in the period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue growth expected over next five years
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2027, industry revenue is estimated to grow at an annualized rate of 1.7% to $5.3 billion. The value of both construction and aggregate private investment are anticipated to rise over the next five years, which will result in sustained demand for the industry's products.

This industry's importance in the construction sector supply chain will likely fuel growth over the next five years. Government highway construction will be bolstered by increasing home values and rising economic activity, both of which will increase government tax revenue. In line with this trend, government funding for highways is anticipated to increase at an annualized rate of 1.0% during the period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Small but steady reliance on trade
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, international trade is anticipated to continue to play a relatively small role in this industry. Over the next five years, industry exports are projected to rise at an annualized rate of 2.3% to $371.6 million, representing 7.0% of industry revenue in 2027.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures aerial work platforms, including boom lifts, scissor lifts, vertical mast lifts, and personal portable lifts. Aerial work platforms may be stationary, towed, or mounted on trucks.

mixed_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: medium - steady

Growth in housing starts and residential construction led to strong gains

market_segmentation.segment: Construction companies and construction rental agencies
market_segmentation.segment_description: Overall, construction represents the largest market for operators in this industry and is estimated to account for 68.0% of industry revenue in 2022. Primarily, construction rental agencies dominate this segment. These agencies purchase all types of different aerial work platforms and rent them to construction workers.

There is a wide range of other markets that purchase a small volume of aerial work platforms; combined, these other markets are estimated to generate 25.2% of revenue. Other buyers include manufacturers, wholesalers, warehouses, home improvement centers, painters, window washers, mechanics, the US government and consumers.

Exports are estimated to account for 6.8% of total industry revenue in 2022. This segment has decreased over the past five years from 8.7% in 2017. Recently, this segment has suffered from an appreciating US dollar, making domestically made goods less affordable for foreign countries.

products_and_services.product_description: Boom lifts are the second-most common type of aerial work platform, estimated to account for 38.7% of revenue, and come in several models. Most boom lifts are powered by traditional engines and hydraulic pistons and swivel at the base; however, electrically powered units have been gaining in popularity.

Scissor lifts are the largest product manufactured by the Aerial Work Platform Manufacturing industry, estimated to generate 56.2% of total industry revenue. The scissor lift does not use a straight support to raise workers in the air, but raises when the folded, linked supports under the platform draw together. When extending, a scissor lift travels faster at the beginning of its climb and slows as it elevates. The contraction can be hydraulic, pneumatic.

Vertical mast lifts are similar to telescopic boom lifts, but move vertically and offer little horizontal movement besides the length of the platform. These lifts are most commonly engine powered and have the ability to swivel. Vertical mast lifts permit vertical access in tight spaces where most articulating lifts are not able to fit.

Similarly, personnel portable lifts move vertically. However, they are much smaller and are typically used to replace ladders. Personnel lifts are simple to set up and designed to roll through doorways, offering the portability of a ladder and the stability of an aerial work platform.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Changes in the economic conditions that affect construction activity also affect demand for the industry's products. Construction activity uses aerial work platforms to access hard to reach areas and extreme heights. During periods of expansion in construction activity the industry generally benefits from increased demand for industry products.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports have grown at an annualized rate of 2.6% to $1.1 billion over the past five years, supported by strong construction activity in Canada and, therefore, demand for aerial work platforms. However, exports declined as the dollar strengthened during the period.

Imports have marginally grown over the past five years, rising at an annualized rate of 0.4% to $990.9 million, representing 17.9% of domestic demand. Demand for imports rose early in the period supported by robust growth in the domestic construction market, buoying import levels overall over the past five years.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region is estimated to account for 24.3% of total industry establishments, well above the region's 14.3% share of the total US population. The area provides a central national location that enables operators to ship to both coasts. Similarly, the region is also close to Canada, one of the largest export markets for operators in the Aerial Work Platform Manufacturing industry.

The Southeast region accounts for 26.3% of industry establishments, just below its 25.9% share of the national population. Florida alone accounts for 10.0% of industry establishments, the largest of any single state. The region is important for all manufacturers because of low labor costs and the presence of manufacturing-friendly legislation.

regulations_points.regulation_description: All aerial lifts must be designed and constructed in compliance with the American National Standards for 'Vehicle Mounted Elevating and Rotating Work Platforms' (ANSI A92.2-1969).
Operators are subject to environmental laws and regulations dealing with noise, air emissions, and with the use, handling and disposal of hazardous materials and waste.
Operators are subject to workplace safety laws housed under the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).
Some operators choose to have their management system certified to the standards set forth by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO).

barriers_points.barrier_description: The revenue volatility level is very high.
The industry assistance level is low and steady.

factors_decreased_barrier.factor: The capital intensity level is low.

basis_points.basis_description: Competition is often based on price, which can put pressure on industry profit margins. However, operators cannot simply cut their products' purchase price. Customers often assess competing products by looking at the total costs over the life of the platform, including up-front purchase, maintenance, and downtime costs, as well as resale value.

Customers typically seek the product that will help complete their project in the fastest, safest and most cost-effective way possible. Consequently, performance and quality are key differentiators among competing companies. Industry operators compete based on a reputation for reliable products that ensure repeat buyers and brand awareness.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top four companies, including JLG Industries Inc. and Terex Corporation, will account for 38.2% of total revenue in 2022.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Despite growth in technology and increasing investment in automation, wages are still an important component of industry costs.
Similar to many manufacturing industries, purchases account for the bulk of operating costs for aerial work platform manufacturers.

Depreciation is estimated to comprise 1.4% of industry revenue in 2022. Industry operators have maintained steady investment in automation and computer technology, which has contributed to depreciation costs.
Marketing costs are low because this industry experiences minimal external competition, accounting for just 0.3% in 2022.
Rental costs are low because operators typically purchase rather than rent facilities due to the scale of operation.
Utilities are expected to account for 0.5% of industry revenue in 2022.
Other costs include administrative costs, insurance, purchased services, research and development, and other expenses.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Aerial Work Platform Manufacturing industry has low to moderate level of capital intensity.
The manufacturing process requires significant capital investments in property, plants, and equipment.
The growth in computer technology, robot construction, and automation over the past five years further increased capital requirements.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Aerial work platforms are primarily used in construction work, especially building and heavy construction.
As a result, demand for the industry's services, and therefore revenue, is heavily dependent on the performance of the overall construction sector.
The construction sector is sensitive to fluctuations over the business cycle, generally booming in times of economic growth and stagnating during downturns.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Aerial Work Platform Manufacturing industry is subject to a moderate level of technological change.
Industry operators are always working to develop new products that can reach higher and further than their predecessors or competitors.
Another growing technology trend is the use of hybrid and electric motors to power the drive mechanisms attached to the aerial work platforms.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Imports are constrained by the large size of the product but are growing quickly. Imports could be affected by tariffs on Chinese imports.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: The industry is heavily influenced by construction demand, which is tied to overall economic health.

FAQs.question: Has your company located in proximity to its key downstream distributors to reduce shipping costs?
FAQs.answer: Companies typically locate in areas with heavy construction activity or heavy mining activity.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Volatility in steel prices has increased the volatility of both revenue and profit margins over the period.

FAQs.question: How does your company invest in technology, such as 3D printing, to establish a competitive edge over your competitors?
FAQs.answer: The main areas of technological innovation are in manufacturing lighter products and incorporating electric and hybrid motors.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Companies are investing in automation, but wage costs remain high.

FAQs.question: What effect have international tariffs had on your ability to import and export products?
FAQs.answer: Industry products are covered under recent tariffs on Chinese imports, and these have been met with retaliatory tariffs on exports.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Recently, there has been an increased focus on safety requirements for industry products due to accidents involving aerial work platforms.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Revenue can be somewhat seasonal, as a large portion of construction activity takes place during the summer.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility of inputs affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Falling steel prices have caused profit margins to rise.

FAQs.question: What measures do you have in place to reduce operational costs? Are you considering any new cost-saving measures? How do you win contracts?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturing costs: Manufacturing incurs substantial purchasing and production costs that are usually dictated by forces outside a company's control (e.g. steel prices). Operators can increase profitability by managing these costs and operating efficiently. Reputation: Do you have a strong reputation among customers? Are you known for your reliability and performance? Having a good reputation. Product quality: How do you maintain product quality? Do you have systems in place to keep standards high and continually updating? If you have had production errors, how did you deal with them? Effective quality control: Effective quality control adds value to a company's brand names by establishing a level of consistency among products. Steel prices: When steel prices rise, how much of the added cost are you able to pass on to customers? How have you maintained profit during periods of high steel prices and low demand? World price of steel: Steel is a major input material for this industry. When the price of steel is high, industry operators experience higher raw material costs. This lets operators pass down these costs to consumers in the form of higher prices, which causes revenue to rise.

FAQs.question: How much of your revenue is generated from exports? Do you compete in the domestic market with any foreign companies?
FAQs.answer: Trade-weighted index: The trade-weighted index (TWI) measures the strength of the US dollar against the currencies of major trading partners. When the TWI increases, it signals an appreciation of the dollar, which makes domestic goods relatively more expensive compared with their international counterparts.

FAQs.question: To which construction markets do you primarily supply products? How have these markets trended in your region in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Value of construction: Aerial work platforms are primarily used during construction. As a result, demand for industry products is heavily driven by the value of construction, which measures the total value of construction work done in the United States. Typically, industry operators benefit from high construction spending because more work platforms are needed.
